author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Transport Department of the State government has informed the National Green Tribunal’s (NGT) Southern Bench here that it has advised owners and drivers of vehicles not to use high-decibel air horns and instead surrender them to the respective Regional Transport Offices (RTOs).

Strict instruction

In his affidavit filed before the NGT in connection with an application filed by A.M. Joseph, the Transport Commissioner stated that the field staff were being strictly instructed repeatedly to remove the high decibel air horn if found on vehicles. When the case came up before the Bench comprising Justice P. Jyothimani and expert member R. Nagendran, the affidavit was submitted.

As per the order of the NGT, “all the Transport Department officials have been directed to issue information to all concerned not to use air horns and also to surrender air horns kept by them,” the affidavit stated.

Despite ban

The NGT had taken suo motu cognizance of the case based on a letter filed by Mr. Joseph of Luz Church Road in Mylapore, who stated that vehicles, including state-owned buses, were using high decibel air horns despite a ban on them by the Supreme Court.
title: Transport Dept. informs NGT of advisory on air horns
